abstract: Norman Corwin, producer and dramatist whose use of sound effects and narrative devices attracted new audiences to radio programming, dies at age 101.
snippet: Mr. Corwin was best known for his dramatizations of American history, vivid human-interest reports from abroad during World War II, adaptations of American literary works and dozens of radio plays.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Corwin was best known for his dramatizations of American history, vivid human-interest reports from abroad during World War II, adaptations of American literary works and dozens of radio plays.

headline.main: Norman Corwin, Pioneer of Radio, Dies at 101
headline.print_headline: Norman Corwin, 101; Rendered Radio Into Poetry
headline.seo: Norman Corwin, Pioneer of Radio, Is Dead at 101
